The above two are both able to reach the third, all places, which is the destination.
Third, The fundamental teachings... cites evidence.
Fourth, However, according to the text below... generally clarifies that there are ten kinds of ability to reach.
The first four are mutually produced, and from the fifth onward, they are all able to reach through the above four.

The fifth and sixth are about reaching through events, the seventh is about reaching through principle, the eighth is about the unobstructed interfusion of events and principle, and the ninth is about the unobstructed interfusion of events, all of which are about the Dharma;
The tenth is about time.
The commentary states sometimes both high and low and briefly forms four statements.
The Buddha transforming into a Buddha, both the original and trace are high;
Bodhisattvas transforming into bodhisattvas, both the original and trace are low.
Within the bodhisattvas, there are also high and low levels based on their stages of development, which should be understood.
The commentary states the above also serves as the cause for the practice of offerings refers to the above explanation of the reasons for expedient transformation.
Because of the power of the tathÄgatagarbha and so forth, it causes the practice of offerings to reach, and thus serves as the cause.
The commentary states because the three bodies and ten bodies are fused explains the reason why the response is also eternal.
If explained according to the characteristics of dharmas, although the response is called eternal, it is not an eternal of uninterrupted continuity.
Now, in the teaching of the nature of dharmas, they are the same in being eternal.
If explained separately, the dharma body has no beginning and no end, the reward body has a beginning but no end, and the transformation body has a beginning and an end.
Now, the transformation is the same as the dharma, so it is also without beginning and end.
Moreover, the reward is the same as the dharma, and also has no beginning.
The meaning of the fusion of the ten bodies can be understood accordingly.

The commentary states, Fragrance and so forth are no different from the covers and so forth means that if one takes fragrance and so forth as twenty things, there are only twenty, not twenty-one, because fragrance pervades the twenty.
It is like taking sandalwood as twenty things, how could there be a separate sandalwood?
